title: Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs a try. One serving contains 543 calories, 17g of protein, and 16g of fat. For $1.57 per serving, this recipe covers 22% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 2. A mixture of butter, white wine, pasta, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. 209 people have tried and liked this recipe. It is brought to you by fullbellysisters.blogspot.com. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a Spoonacular score of 83%, which is tremendous. If you like this recipe, take a look at these similar recipes: Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs, Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs, and Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs.

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F.
Whisk together the flour, pecans, granulated sugar, light brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl.
Whisk together the eggs, buttermilk, butter and vanilla extract and vanilla bean in a small bowl.
Add the egg mixture to the dry mixture and gently mix to combine. Do not overmix.
Let the batter sit at room temperature for at least 15 minutes and up to 30 minutes before using.

Heat a cast iron or nonstick griddle pan over medium heat and brush with melted butter. Once the butter begins to sizzle, use 2 tablespoons of the batter for each pancake and cook until the bubbles appear on the surface and the bottom is golden brown, about 2 minutes, flip over and cook until the bottom is golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes longer.
Transfer the pancakes to a platter and keep warm in a 200 degree F oven.
Serve 6 pancakes per person, top each with some of the bourbon butter.
Drizzle with warm maple syrup and dust with confectioners' sugar.
Garnish with fresh mint sprigs and more toasted pecans, if desired.
Combine the bourbon and sugar in a small saucepan and cook over high heat until reduced to 3 tablespoons, remove and let cool.
Put the butter, molasses, salt and cooled bourbon mixture in a food processor and process until smooth.
Scrape into a bowl, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld.
Remove from the refrigerator about 30 minutes before using to soften.

extendedIngredients.name: cauliflower florets
extendedIngredients.original: about 2 cups frozen cauliflower florets, thawed, cut into bite-sized pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: about frozen cauliflower florets, thawed, cut into bite-sized pieces

extendedIngredients.name: couple of pepper flakes
extendedIngredients.original: couple of pinches red pepper flakes, optional
extendedIngredients.originalName: couple of red pepper flakes, optional

extendedIngredients.name: scallions
extendedIngredients.original: 3 scallions, chopped, white and green parts separated
extendedIngredients.originalName: scallions, chopped, white and green parts separated

extendedIngredients.name: bread crumbs
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup whole wheat bread crumbs (I used panko)

title: Spicy Arrabbiata Penne
summary: Grilled Flank Steak Salad with Cilantro-Lime Dressing might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 4 and costs $3.2 per serving. One portion of this dish contains approximately 31g of protein, 31g of fat, and a total of 529 calories. 66 people were impressed by this recipe. A mixture of lime juice, flank steak, garlic, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. 45 minutes are needed to prepare this recipe. 83% would make this recipe again. All things considered, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 84%, which is excellent. Try Grilled Flank Steak Salad with Cilantro-Lime Dressing, Mexican-Style Flank Steak Salad with Honey-Lime Dressing, and Flank Steak Salad with Chimichurri Dressing for similar recipes.

title: Chicken Alfredo with Broccoli
summary: A tasty main course, Chicken Alfredo with Broccoli has 650 calories, 30g of protein, and 40g of fat per serving. Costs $2.50 per serving and serves 4. Ready in 30 minutes.

title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Bacon, Pecans, and Maple Syrup
summary: Give Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Bacon, Pecans, and Maple Syrup a try; it serves 4 at $2.39 per serving. Each serving offers 326 calories, 8g protein, and 21g fat. This recipe, enhanced with bacon, maple syrup, pecans, and more, promises delightful flavors. 185 people have enjoyed this recipe, available from savorysimple.net. It takes about 30 minutes from prep to plate and earns a Spoonacular score of 92%, reflecting its excellence. For similar recipes, visit Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Bacon, Pecans, and Maple Syrup, Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Bacon, Pecans, and Maple Syrup, and Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Bacon, Pecans, and Maple Syrup.
